class_notes:
For 1st year students and sophomores only.


Certain great books have been influential across the centuries, and continue to influence the way we think, act, and understand ourselves today. We will read parts of some of the most famous books ever written: Machiavelli's The Prince, Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations, Thomas Malthus, Essay on Population, Karl Marx's Communist Manifesto, Charles Darwin's On the Origin of Species and Sigmund Freud's Civilization and its Discontents.  Three short papers, a midterm, and a final.  This course is a discussion-based seminar.  It is also part of Emory College's Voluntary Core Curriculum.
course_description: Part of Emory's Voluntary Core Curriculum. Certain great books have been influential across the centuries, and continue to influence the way we think, act, and understand ourselves today. Major themes of the course are the history of religion, politics, economics, biology, and psychology.
